alert.note: Alert for Wetzel (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pittsburgh (Western Pennsylvania and East Central Ohio)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 05 at 3:48PM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT SOUTH CENTRAL HARRISON... SOUTHEASTERN GUERNSEY...MONROE...BELMONT...EASTERN NOBLE AND NORTHWESTERN WETZEL COUNTIES THROUGH 415 PM EDT... At 347 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 9 miles southeast of Byesville to 7 miles northeast of Marietta. Movement was northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... New Martinsville, Barnesville, Woodsfield, Paden City, Bethesda, Flushing, Quaker City, Sardis, Senecaville, Belmont, Beallsville, and Clarington. This includes Interstate 70 in Ohio between mile markers 189 and 214. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
